name: bromegrass, Ripgut brome, Ripgut grass
overview: The seeds easily break out of the spikelet. They are very sharp and very rough due to tiny barb-like hairs that face backwards, allowing the seed to catch and lodge like a fish hook.
habitat: Although invasive in California, it does best in areas with a Mediterranean climate, such as California and parts of southern Australia, but it is quite tolerant of many climates.
tags: oat spiky brome plant plants stuck in my socks
